results.title: Six days seven nights
results.creator_credit: Ivan Reitman, Roger Birnbaum, Wallis Nicita and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: The perfect scenario - a remote island vacation with the man you love. He proposes, you say yes, life is wonderful. Then you are called away to do a one-day shoot in Tahiti and suddenly your life changes. High-powered New York magazine editor Robin Monroe (Anne Heche) finds herself in this very situation when the plane, engaged for the one-day shoot and piloted by the rough and ready Quinn Harris (Harrison Ford), is forced to land in stormy weather on an unknown remote island. Robin and Quinn are left to deal with each other, with survival and an uncertain future, whilst Robin’s boyfriend Frank (David Schwimmer) and Quinn’s girlfriend Angelica (Jacqueline Obradors) share their fears and concern at the hotel bar. Filmed on location on the Hawaiian island of Kauai. Cast also includes Allison Janney, Temuera Morrison.

results.title: Six Chevaux Bleus = Six Blue Horses
results.brief_description:
A Chinese man inherit six blue porcelain horses and discovers that one of them contains the combination to a safe filled with diamonds. In order to recover the diamonds which are guarded by an antiquarian, the old man’s nephews must contend with a gang of criminals.

Credits: Producer, Michel Peynet ; director, Philippe Joulia ; writers, Philippe Joulia, Yves Desmoulin ; photography, Jacques Ledoux ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Henri Cremieux, Yvonne Clech, Corinne Le Poulain, Patrick Boitet, Pascal Boitet.

results.title: Sitcom (D)
results.creator_credit: Francois Ozon, Marc Missonnier, Olivier Delbosc and Fidelite Productions
results.brief_description: An outrageously twisted black comedy from French writer-director Francois Ozon, documenting how the bourgeois existence of a French family is turned upside-down after the father brings home a pet rat. The film opens with the father, Jean (Francois Marthouret), gunning down his entire family at his birthday party. Flashing back several months earlier, the sordid story begins to unfold as mother Helene (Evelyne Dandry) shows the new Spanish maid, Maria, around the house. At dinner, son Nicolas (Adrien de Van) abruptly announces that he is gay. His sister, Sophie (Adrien’s real-life sister, Marina de Van), attempts suicide, leaving herself a bitter paraplegic, while her boyfriend, David, tries to prove his undying love to her by engaging in a series of humiliating sadomasochistic experiences. The situation becomes more complicated when Maria refuses to do any cleaning, and gets caught seducing David, and her teacher husband, Abdu, becomes Nicolas’ sexual mentor. Helene, unable to understand what has happened to her family but determined to resolve matters, decides to begin by having sex with her son to “cure” him of his homosexuality. Through all this mayhem, Jean manages to stay calm, until he is forced by the family to give up his beloved pet rat. In a scene reminiscent of “The Cook, the Thief, his Wife and her Lover”, the rat is disposed of, a bizarre act that has extraordinary consequences for the entire household. “Sitcom” was screened in the International Critics Week section at the 1998 Cannes Film Festival. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Sisters in arms
results.brief_description: 100 years of Australian military nursing is celebrated in this collection of personal accounts and archival footage. The contribution of Australian nurses has spanned across many wars; the Boer War, Great War, World War 2, as well as battles in the Mediterranean, New Guinea and Vung Tau. It is from these often tragic environments that stories of hope, courage, duty, adventure and romance emerge and are shared with the viewer. Narrated by Geraldine Dooge.

results.title: Sister, if you only knew
results.creator_credit: Janet Isaac, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The theme of this film is about the pressures on Aboriginal women living in the city…what effect it has also on their men and their children. The film focuses on four women and the part they played in the movement demanding more equal opportunities for urban Aboriginals, for better conditions, the removal of discriminatory Acts, etc. Although life is difficult the women seem to survive better than the men. Their humour, intelligence and resilience in the face of life’s difficulties often surprise people who see this film. The women are Leila Rankine (Music and Tribal Culture Education), Ruby Hammond (Legail Aid), Mary Williams (Aboriginal Kindergarten) and Gladys Elphick, MBE (President, Aboriginal Women’s Council).

results.title: Sister Wendy's odyssey. -Volume 2
results.creator_credit: John Hooper, Nicholas Rossiter and BBC
results.brief_description: Sister Wendy Beckett has a passion for art and leaves the confines of her religious silence in search of the art treasures she has found in books and on postcards. For Sister Wendy art represents a window to something greater, and when one is looking at art, one is looking at God. In this second part of the odyssey in which Sister Wendy openly shares her first impressions of seeing the art she’s admired, she visits Wilton House, Birmingham, and Edinburgh stopping to reflect on her favourite pieces. PLEASE NOTE: THERE IS A CLOCK TIMER BETWEEN EACH EPISODE ON THE TAPE.

results.title: Sister my sister
results.creator_credit: Nancy Meckler, Norma Heyman, Channel 4 and NFH Productions
results.brief_description: Based on a murder case which occurred in 1934 in a provincial French village, this psychological drama is set almost wholly within the claustrophobic confines of a bourgeois household. Two sisters are employed as maids for a prudish, arrogant, middle-aged widow and the frumpy grown daughter she clings to for companionship. Immaculately groomed and discreet, the sisters slave endlessly without complaint for years to meet the perfectionist standards of the mistress of the house. Seeking any relief from this cold, oppressive environment, the sisters, who are also bound to one another in an unhealthy co-dependent relationship, eventually become lovers. As their relationship becomes increasingly tortured, the burden of meeting their employer’s expectations strains class tensions to breaking point. Beginning with the scene of the horrific murder that almost inevitably occurs, the film then effectively builds the pressure cooker atmosphere of class division, sexual repression and co-dependence that provided fertile ground for this seemingly incomprehensible crime. Cast: Julie Waters, Joely Richardson, Jodhi May, Sophie Thursfield.

results.title: Sir John Everett Millais
results.creator_credit: Anita Sterner, Kenneth Gordon and BBC
results.brief_description: Made to celebrate the 150th anniversary of Millais’ birth. This program retraces his life and work through letters to and from his contemporaries and through a large collection of paintings and drawings. Provides a complement to “The Pre-Raphaelite revolt”. Narrated by Anne Massey.

results.title: Sir Jack Brabham: The complete history of a motor racing legend
results.creator_credit: Neville Hay and Hay Fisher Productions
results.brief_description: Brabham - one of the great names in motor racing history. A great driver who not only became a household name worldwide during the 1950’s and 60’s for his driving exploits, but who also created a racing team that was still winning in the 1980’s. This story of Sir Jack Brabham, told exclusively in his own words and by close associates including Stirling Moss, Roy Salvadori and and John Cooper. Extensive archival material captures the feel of some glorious motor racing while tracing every step of a truly brilliant career.

results.title: Sir Alec Guinness Ealing comedy: Kind hearts and coronets; The Man in the white suit; The Lavender Hill mob; The Ladykillers
results.creator_credit: Alexander Mackendrick, Charles Crichton, Robert Hamer and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description: Four features starring Sir Alec Guinness produced by the revered Ealing studio. In “The Ladykillers” Guinness guides a gang of misfits through a daring robbery only to be foiled by their seemingly harmless, elderly landlady. Set in Edwardian England, “Kind hearts and coronets” sees Guinness play eight parts - all victims of a serial killer, determined to claim his birthright. A satire on industry and commerce “The Man in the white suit” features Guinness as a would-be chemist who develops an indestructible fabric. Guinness plays a timid bank clerk who has the perfect scheme for stealing gold bullion from the Bank of England in “The Lavender Hill mob”. These four comedies highlight Guinness’ unerring talent for satire and farce. Also available on VHS “The Lavender Hill Mob” [302796], “Kind Hearts and coronets” [302542], “The Ladykillers” [304307], “The Man in the white suit” [507924].
